To learn about the parsnip package, see [*Get Started: Build a Model*](/start/models/). Use the tables below to find [prediction types for different models and engines](#models).

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}

library(dplyr)
library(purrr)
library(tidyr)
library(parsnip)
library(DT)

yep <- cli::symbol$tick
nope <- cli::symbol$cross

mod_names <- get_from_env("models")
model_info <-
  map_dfr(mod_names, \(.x) {
    get_from_env(paste0(.x, "_predict")) |> mutate(model = .x)
  })

model_info |>
  select(model, engine, mode, type) |>
  pivot_wider(
    names_from = type,
    values_from = mode,
    values_fill = nope,
    values_fn = function(x) yep
  ) |>
  datatable(
    rownames = FALSE,
    class = 'cell-border stripe',
    filter = 'top',
    escape = FALSE,
    options = list(pageLength = 25)
  )
```
